name: illusionary
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not real and based on illusion (= ideas or beliefs that are not true): There is never a moment when the audience feels pulled out of the illusionary world. It may be argued that the accountability of politicians is illusionary.
More examplesFewer examplesThose two things are equally illusionary, and the sooner we learn that lesson, the better. The distinction between these two methods is more illusionary than real.The illusionary benefits of cheaper exports are eroded because of the high value of the dollar.
